intro: Chaetanthera microphylla var. depauperata, commonly known as the slender chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers are white to pale yellow, arranged in umbels. It is a relatively uncommon species, valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
